item.description:
Merlin is the most powerful wizard in the land. Sometimes he's kind and benevolent to the citizens and aspiring wizards. However, in the spirit of the saying, "absolute power corrupts absolutely", the reality is that Merlin's greed has led him to be a merciless tyrant with complete control of the magic industry. He has hoarded all the mana, as well as all of the magical ingredients, forcing the noble and mystical races of the time into indentured servitude and obedience. Fairies are harvested for the magical properties of their wings. Zombies are risen from the dead, sapped of their blood, then disposed of in ways that are unbecoming even for the undead. Orcs, dwarves, and gnomes are strong-armed into complacency, tacitly serving their master.

As an aspiring wizard yourself, you are aware that Merlin has a created a ceiling on your advancement. As long as he is at the top, you will never achieve the glory and notoriety that you deserve. Because of this, you and other wizards know that there is only one way to end Merlin's megalomaniacal reign. You must kill him. After years of clandestine research, you have discovered a secret formula of 4 spells which, when cast together, are capable of completing the job. However, you've heard that other wizards have also figured out their own ways to deal with this tyrant.

Buy ingredients, learn spells, cast spells to thwart your opponents, and be the first to defeat Merlin so that all may revere your glory.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
In Kids DOG, players use cards in their hand to move their three dogs from their start space to home. On a player's turn, they play one of the three cards in their hand, then move one of their three dogs according to what's on the card played:


 A colored paw moves your dog to the next space of that color.
 Two colored paws moves you to the second space of that color.
 A "dog swap" card lets you exchange places between one of your dogs and an opponent's dog, as long as they're not at home or in a protective kennel.
 A double-color card lets you move to the next space of either color.
 A kennel card moves you to the next empty kennel on the board.


Land on an opponent's dog with one of your own, and they have to start from the beginning once again. If you'd land on one of your own dogs, you can instead jump it and move to the next space of this color.

The first player to get all three dogs home wins!

item.description:
Go, go, go! The three magicians Conrad, Mila, and Vicky rush out of the dark castle Rabenfels to escape the nasty wizard Rabenhorst. They reach the mysterious castle lake, but wait, what's happening? As if by magic, Conrad, Mila, and Vicky are repeatedly held back — or even driven back toward the castle...

In Der geheimnisvolle Zaubersee ("The Mysterious Magic Lake"), you need to cover the right cards to free the three magicians from the mysterious spell. Only by working as a team can you reach the safety of the shore and escape Rabenhorst!

name.value: Arnold Takes Command: The Battle of Bemis Heights

item.description:
Arnold Takes Command is a new kind of card-driven wargame for two players, ages 12 to 99. Unlike most of its siblings, in this game movement plays an insignificant role. Additionally, prior experience with traditional wargames isn’t required. ATC isn’t a dice-rolling slugfest or a “take that” affair. Here, it’s all about the card play: what to play, when to play it, what to discard, what to track, etc.

The game has two distinct phases, just like the actual battle. Players use action cards of various types to attack, defend, gain initiative, maneuver, emulate morale, take cover, use “fog of war” to their advantage, and so forth. Single “duds” are discarded, but pairs have a useful purpose.

A preponderance of “split” action cards ensures a nice variance from game to game. Components include 70+ cards and two maps.

—description from the designer

By flicking your ship you’ll smash into strange worlds (and other players) to collect useful resources. Each player will be trying to turn their resources into powerful spaceship upgrades for attack, defense, resource generation, or victory point production - all to give them the edge in conquering this new-found galaxy.

On your turn you will collect the resource from the hex your spaceship is on (which might be where you left it last turn...), flick your spaceship into a new hex, then invest in upgrades for your spaceship.

There are 12 available technologies in a game worth different amounts of victory points at the end of the game. In addition, victory point tokens can be taken from a central pool for the successful use of certain upgrades. The game ends when a fixed number of upgrades have been bought or the victory point pool is exhausted.

item.description:
Comic Turns is a comics storytelling game system – a deck of cards where each has a comic panel all carefully designed so that they can be arranged in any order to make countless new comic strips and infinite stories.

The deck comes with optional rules for three games included; ways to play competitively, collaboratively, and just to explore the storytelling possibilities, but user-created rules and ways to play are highly encouraged!

In the included rules, gameplay involves adding or replacing cards from a hand or pool to create narratives. The goal is always to create the best, most unique, interesting or fun stories. In a competitive version of the game, players have to fill in the middle of a story between a start and end card with cards from their hand. They take it in turns to reveal and tell their stories, and then vote for a winner. Voting is done by simultaneous pointing at the person whose comic strip you liked the best. In the collaborative versions, the emphasis is on building stories as a group, either by adding panels, or swapping panels out for new ones.

Comic Turns is also a tool for learning about comics, building stories, inspiring creative writing and sparking the imagination.

We write the year 1623 and there is war in the German lands. Even from distance, you can hear the steady beating of the drums. The recruiters with their sounding coins come to town and try to recruit new soldiers for the mercenary armies, which are being excavated everywhere. You hope the recruiters will be successful because they work on your behalf.

Ernst von Mansfeld is a tactical dice game for 2 to 4 players and is divided into the 2 consecutive phases recruiting and conquering. 
In the recruitment, the players try to win as many and powerful soldiers as possible for their mercenary army. This requires tactics and clever consideration of the risk, as the player who dares to reach the required dice value with fewer dice than his competitors may try his luck first.
In the second phase, the players have to compete with their deployed armies against each other to conquer different valuable provinces. The smart use of your own troops as well as the correct anticipation of the tactics of the opponents are necessary to secure the provinces and to enter history as the most successful mercenary general.

GENERAL INFO: 1-5 players, 30 minutes, 5 play modes including competitive and cooperative play.


 Cooperative team-play with game controlled Zombies.
 Cooperative team-play with Zombies controlled by a non-team player.
 Competitive free-for-all with game controlled Zombies.
 Competitive free-for-all with Zombies controlled by a player.
 Solo.


THEME: Modern day Zombie outbreak at the Echo Ridge Mall.

HOOK: Fast paced, portable, and tons of replayability. Play as the survivors or the Zombies. Plus ITEMeeples!

WIN: Survivors must complete 3 objectives - Zombies must kill all the Survivors or gain control of the Mall's Courtyard.

OVERVIEW: In Tiny Epic Zombies, survivors are always on the run, collecting weapons, killing Zombies and working toward completing objectives. Completing 3 objectives can win you the game but if you're too focused on the objectives, the Zombies will overrun the mall and that will be the end of you.

Based on the mode of play, you will either play as one of the Survivors or as the Zombies.

As a Survivor, your turn will consist of moving 3 times. Then based on where you move, you'll be able to do additional things. For instance, if you move into a room with a Zombie, you'll have to fight it by rolling the Zombie die. Or if you move into a room adjacent to a Zombie, you can spend ammo to shoot it. Killing a Zombie is actually pretty easy... but they just keep coming. Keeping them from overrunning the entire mall, while trying to accomplish your objectives, that is hard!

After you've taken your 3 moves, you'll search the room. This is done by revealing the Search Card you are holding. Most of the time, you find something useful, like awesome items you can later pickup and equip to your ITEMeeples. Sometimes though, you may find a Zombie lurking in the corner. So be prepared.
After you search the room, more Zombies flood into the Mall. Then it's the next player's turn. Simple as that.

Note: If your ammo and wound tokens ever meet, you're dead meat! So, keep your wounds low and your ammo high.

If you die, that character will turn into a Zombie and you'll have to draw a new character to play. If that happens too many times, you lose the game.

As a Zombie player, not only will you control unique Zombies with special abilities, you will control ALL the Zombies! With your help, the Zombies will have a brain in addition to eating brains. Your game will be to overwhelm the players with clever placement and movement of the Zombies. Smother them with your Zombie horde and prevent them from completing their objectives. If you kill enough players or overrun the mall courtyard, you win.

item.description:
This is a Book of Mormon themed game of Nerts. Here is the description from the back of the game:
"This fast-paced game combines the concentration of Solitaire with the quickness of Speed - and throws in a Book of Mormon twist. Each player is given one of the decks of 48 cards representing the Nephites, Lamanites, Jaredites, or Mulekites. Players try to be first to rid themselves of their pride piles by building prosperity piles in the middle of the table. The fun rises to a feverish pitch as everyone begins flipping and placing cards at the same time!
The breathless action comes to a screeching halt when the first 'pride-less" person yells out whatever favorite Book of Mormon name was chosen at the beginning of the hand - if they can remember it!"

Will Your Project Suck or Succeed?

In the game, you are the project lead on a front-end web app development project for a well known enterprise software and services company. Your goal is to complete your milestone before your rival project lead completes theirs.

To complete a milestone you turn over a card and earn points towards your milestone. Seems simple right? Well, just like in real life, there’s a lot of mayhem laying in wait to throw your project into chaos.

item.description:
In Consequence, players take turns to place tiles strategically on the grid face down with the goal to get its own tiles in intersecting rows and the other tiles spread out.

You score by pairs of your own symbol, regardless of the color of the tile.

The blue player scores with pairs of moons and the red player score with pairs of suns. Rows, columns and diagonals of symbols could cross, and the tile that is in the joint of counts as part of both when scoring, horizontally, vertically and diagonally at the same time.

—description from the publisher

Gameplay: At the start of the game, players hide their discs from the other players eyes. Keep the discs hidden throughout the game.

The players will take turns placing one disc on the grid upside down, goal is to get your own pieces in a row (or rows) and the other player's discs spread out.

At your turn: Place one disc on an empty square the board OR move one disc (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) on the board to an adjacent empty square OR place and push a row of discs one square aside (making the disc already on the board slide one square in chosen direction (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Discs that fall out of the grid because of this push is picked up by the pushing player regardless of the color of the disc. Discs picked up may be seen and used by that player, place it among the concealed discs or in your palm.

To make the push discs move, there have to be an empty square where to place the pushing disc at start of the pushing. You could not start off grid pushing a row or column only from an empty spot within the grid.

Final scoring: As all discs is placed on the board, you flip them over and score points. You score points both horizontally, vertically and diagonally, you score your own symbol discs and disregard blank discs.Note that you score regardless of color of the disc as long as it got your symbol.

Rows of symbols could cross, and the disc that is in the joint of both rows counts as part of both rows when scoring (both horizontally, vertically and diagonally).

One isolated disc = 0 points
Two in a row = 2 points
Three in a row = 3 points
Four in a row = 4 points

Combinations of above 2-12 points

—description from the designer

item.description:
Sellswords and Spellslingers is a solo and cooperative fantasy miniatures game for 1 to 6 players.

Each player creates a party of fantasy adventurers with a point system. Then players choose a scenario and try to complete a mission. Foes and events are moved automatically by a deck of cards. Characters grow with experience, and a list of campaign activities is provided.

The game is sold as a pdf set of rules and requires printing a deck of cards.

There are mechanical similarities to Song of Blades and Heroes, by the same author.

link.value: Sellswords and Spellslingers: Count Cariali's Curse

item.description:
Domino Zootiere is a cute arranging fun for 2-3 children ages 2 years and older. Who will get rid of all their domino cards first?

How to play:

Do you have a domino card with one of the two animals?

Yes? – Excellent! Then place the domino card so that the animals that are the same are next to each other.
No? – Too bad! You can't place a domino card; take one domino card from the stack and place it face-up in front of you. If the new domino card matches a picture on the table then you may immediately place it.

End of the game
If players can no longer place any cards and there are no more face-down cards, then the game is over. If a player successfully places all their domino cards, they win the game

Domino Baustelle is a cute arranging fun for 2-3 children ages 2 years and older. Who will get rid of all their domino cards first?

How to play:

Do you have a domino card with one of the two building site pictures? 
Yes? – Excellent! Then place the domino card so that the pictures that are the same are next to each other.
No? – Too bad! You can't place a domino; take one domino card from the stack and place it face-up in front of you. If the new domino card matches a picture on the table then you may immediately place it.

End of the game 
If players can no longer place any cards and there are no more face-down cards, then the game is over. If a player successfully places all of their domino cards, they win the game!

Memo Bauernhof provides entertaining memory fun for 2-4 children from 2 years. Who can remember the positions of the barnyard pictures and collect the most pairs?

How to play:

Did you turn over two of the same picture? Excellent! You can take the pair and keep it. 
 
Did you turn over two different pictures? Too bad, but it's OK! Once everyone else has has a chance to see the barnyard cards you can turn them back over again.

End of the game 
Have all the pairs been collected? Then all children place their barnyard cards next to each other: The player with the longest row of cards wins the game.

Memo Fahrzeuge provides entertaining memory fun for 2-4 children ages 2 years and older. Who can remember the positions of the vehicles and collect the most pairs?

How to play:

Did you turn over two of the same vehicle? Excellent! You can take the pair and keep it. 
 
Did you turn over two different vehicles? Too bad, but it's OK! Once everyone has the opportunity to see the vehicle cards you can turn them back over again.

End of the game
Have all the pairs been collected? Then all children place their vehicle cards next to each other: The player with the longest vehicle fleet wins the game.

Lotto Fahrzeuge is a fun matching game for 2-4 children from 2 years. Who will be the first to fill their own base card with the right vehicles?

How to play:

Children play in a clockwise direction, taking turns. The youngest child begins and turns over a vehicle card. Everyone compares this vehicle card with their own base card. The player who finds the vehicle on their base card can take the vehicle card and place it face-up on their base card.

End of the game
The first player to place all three vehicle cards on their own base card wins the game!

Lotto Feenland is a fun matching game for 2-4 children from 2 years. Who will be the first to fill their own base card with the matching fairyland friends?

How to play:

Children play in a clockwise direction, taking turns. The youngest child begins and turns over a fairy card. Everyone compares this fairy card with their own base card. The player who finds the fairy on their base card can take the fairy card and place it face-up on their base card.

End of the game
The first player to place all three fairy cards on their own base card wins the game!

As a tight-knit team in Menara, players use pillars and wondrously-shaped temple floors to build a spectacularly soaring structure full of nooks and crannies. Cooperation and static skills are in demand since for each mistake in construction, you have to add another floor to the temple.

A steady hand, an alert mind, and mutual assistance can help you successfully complete what seems to top out at dizzy heights...

item.description:
Did a cow-ard brush the spots off the cowhide over night?! Flick Fleck presents 1-4 children with the cow-rious task of giving cows their spots back. Players puzzle together black-and-white tiles on the bare hide of their cow to create consistent patterns. Spatial imagination and smart decisions are in demand: What fits where on which cowhide? Flick Fleck intuitively trains the understanding of forms and connections.

The course of the game is easy to grasp for young children and even remains fascinating for cow-loving adults as well.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
First she breezes, then she brews! On a wild whirling flight, Winnie the witch follows the tip of her broom. The ingredients for her favorite potion are widely scattered across mountains and valleys. To collect them, players let Winnie spin around until her broom determines the direction of her flight route. If you can elicit the right witchy magic from the magical folding books, you'll collect the ingredients the witch has flown over — but jinxed books swap places...

In Saus und Brau's, children (but also adults!) can combine the magic power of their fingertips with the sharpness of an alert mind.

item.description:
Contame (Tell me) is a narrative game, in which a player draws a card from deck "Histories". Then, he chooses one from deck "Actions" and five from deck "Draws". He must create a story using elements from all the cards, that includes a number of points awarded to the story-teller by the other players if he uses them correctly.
After everybody has been the story-teller, the person with more points is the winner.

item.description:
In this 4-player game, the object of the game is to be appointed Mayor of Evercent Springs. This is done by becoming the first Candidate to unlock the door to Evercent Springs with your Silver Key. Each Candidate is provided with 7 Companions to assist and fight for them; players must use them to stop their opponents from reaching the door while at the same time protecting their own Candidate and Silver Keys.

At the start of the game, each Candidate has a Silver Key and one Companion from each town carries a Spare Key. If you lose both Keys, your hopes of becoming Mayor are over and you are out of the game.
During the game you will face many challenges, including opponents, pubs, holes, havens, bribes, and the Council.

The players start in their Hometowns; the door to Evercent Springs is located at the center of the board. On your turn, you move one piece. You can move your Candidate closer to the door; you can move away from an aggressive opponent’s piece; you can go to the Pub; or, you can capture an opponent’s piece and thereby eliminate it from the game. You can only capture an opponent’s piece if it’s within reach AND is lower ranked than your piece; the Council has ranked the Companions according to three categories, and the Council’s Cards show which category is now being used to rank the Companions. The players can meet with the Councillors during the game and try to have them change the category; you get to turn over a new Council’s Card and hope for the category you want. Or, you can bribe The Council, and get to choose category!

Bribing The Council is one of the Ways & Means in the game; if you have Gold Coins, you can purchase advantages. You can also purchase an Extra Step; a Hole Tile that will make a square on the board unusable; a Haven Tile to protect your Candidate; or even buy back eliminated Companions to the game. If you want to buy Ways & Means, that must be done prior to moving your piece. 
With Gold Coins, you can also make Deals with your opponents…
To get your hands on more Gold Coins, you can get lucky with the Pub cards, or eliminate opponents’ pieces. Or make good deals!
Should your Candidate be captured, and you still have the Spare Key, you’re still in the game. The Companion carrying the Spare Key is sacrificed and removed from the board, and your Candidate is being put back on your Hometown’s Street, but you can still reach the door to Evercent Springs and win the game.

If you lose your second key as well, then it’s game over for you. 
Only Candidates can unlock the door to Evercent Springs, and thereby win the game.

Strategy, tactics, luck and bribes are some of the tools to win this game; keeping your Candidate with their Silver key safe and at the same time be bold enough to first reach the door to be appointed Mayor of Evercent Springs.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Your Family Rocks puts your family memories at the center of the board game. The game uses your own family photos as the 60 “family cards” in the game, being the first your-photos-into-cards board game, where your photos play the central role in the game mechanics, influencing the gameplay, strategy, and outcome.

Whatever is in your pictures is now fair game – you are now the creator of your own game!

The game unfolds over different dynamics about family memories (photos). The better the players perform on these dynamics - Challenges - the more Family Time they will earn. As in real life, it takes time to raise a family, so players will use their Family Time to grow their family members, values, rules and objects - each worth different prosperity points.

At the end of game, the most prosperous family wins.

—description from the publisher

Game PYTAKI is a nice, simple integration game for the whole family. Thanks to intuitive mechanics, you can start playing PYTAKI right away. This is important because many people do not like playing games because of their complicated rules. It's enough that only one person reads the instruction beforehand and is able to bring the whole family into play in a minute.

Game Play:
On your turn you draw a task tile requiring you to answer personal question or perform specific task. Tasks may involve additional components like Mood dice (for example you roll them and then tell what makes you feel the mood rolled). Play continues until the stack of tiles is exhausted. There is no winner per se.

Polish edition of Pytaki sold more than 10000 copies.

---

To waÅ¼ne, poniewaÅ¼ wiele osób nie lubi graÄ‡ w gry ze wzglÄ™du na ich skomplikowane zasady. For centuries, heroes roamed Magnu, exploring its many dungeons, avoiding armies of evil overlords, and defeating dragons (for the right price). Those times are now long past, and a new breed of warrior bestrides the land: the rock star!

Being part of an up-and-coming rock band, you are about to embark on your first tour. Magnu is still populated by elves, dwarves, and goblins, but now they are your audience. Dungeons still exist but are just as likely to have heritage status, while dragons are a protected species. Do you have the right song to appeal to the undead, or will your gig be saved by a bunch of easy-to-please halflings? Will you lose another drummer in a bar fight? And why do the dwarves have to chuck things at you?

This innovative game combining 1960s rock-and-roll and a world of fantasy takes the role-playing board game as we know it to a whole new level. This 1-5 player game that can be played in around two to three hours creates a fast-moving, entertaining experience that will keep the most jaded gamer happy for hours.

Now, instead of killing dragons, you must slay audiences. Your band will be rated for its melodiousness and energy but remember, audiences have different tastes, and it's up to you to best entertain with the right songs. Success allows you to develop new skills and the ability to take on more demanding audiences and the money made from your record sales allows you to buy better songs and devices such as the Banjo of Protection. The latter may be of use as Magnu is still not a safe land to travel around – the Moral Majority is upset as they don't like this new-fangled "rock music".

You are not restricted to just playing gigs in Monster Rock. You can also embark on adventures to explore dungeons and take on the few fearsome dragons left. You can even challenge the Devil to a rock-off, but beware, failure means somebody is going to Hell!

Will you have what it takes to keep your audiences entertained?

name.value: Might and Magic: Duel of Champions PnP

item.description:
Duel of Champions is strategy card game set in the fantastic Might and Magic universe, where six factions fight for power. The game goal is to bring your opponent's life total to 0. You do so by deploying Creatures, Buildings, casting Spells or using Fortunes and Events in your favor. You also need to choose a hero - champion that will lead your army into battle. Each hero offers different playstyle, so choose wisely. Game is turn based.

—description from the designer

This very simple subtraction math game is called Räkna riddare ("Count Knights") on the box and "Minusleken" ("The Minus Game") in the rules.

Players are dealt a number of cards which come in two types, subtraction questions (e.g. "9-2" or "6-4") and results numbered 0-8. One player states a question from one of their cards, and the other players should call out the correct answer providing they hold a corresponding card. The rules contradict themselves on the subject of drawing cards and hand sizes, but basically you keep matching pairs and drawing. The rules are also inconsistent between languages when to end the game: either when all cards have been drawn, or until no more matches can be made between hands. At this point matching pairs in hand are added to pairs taken during play and the player with the most pairs wins.

—user summary

You will gain control of 1 of 4 unique Cat Kingdoms seeking dominance of your the home. Control your stores of Catnip, Recruit Knight Cats, Fulfill Secret Royal Decrees, Raise your Kingdom's Instinct, Honor, and use your cat army to conquer Territory, Toys, and Food for command of Victory Points.

The Kingdom with the most victory points wins!

This game combines hand and resource management, set collection, and competitive and cooperative play.

Tremendous replay value and family fun appeal with colorful components and a cute theme parodying the lives of our furry cat friends.

—description from the publisher

In this FREE print & play, you can live the dream of being a Flip the Table panelist and play cheesy, weird, and obscure board games in your quest to be the first to score 10,000 POINTS! On your turn, you might buy cheesy games at Flip's Thrift shop! Or risk all your hard-earned quarters at The Professor's Lazer Arcade! Or possibly go to Jared's Wrestling Academy and fight for the world title! Or even use Chris's Editing Bay to manipulate time and space! Play the games and get the points, but until you sell them when you pass go, the points might be taken from you! And as always, beware of Soviet Russia...because in Soviet Russia, TABLE FLIPS YOU!

And did we mention it's a roll-and-move game? SURPRISE!!!

Each of the two or three players in Chomp-itz Crocodile Dinner straps an elongated crocodile snout to their face, then races to catch their four colored fish so that they can then snatch the gold fish to win the game!

name.value: Punk Rock Book Tour: The Boardgame

item.description:
Live the adventurous life of a publisher on the road! Meet fans, discover rare books, get peed on by cats! Just make sure you can scrape up enough gas money to get to the next city or it's game over, man, game over.

In Punk Rock Book Tour: The Boardgame, you go on a book tour with limited supplies. The player with the best haircut goes first. Drive the biofuel truck to PICK UP WASTE GREASE. Drive the waste grease to the PROCESSING CENTER to make fuel. Then drive to YOUR EVENT and on to the next city. If you run out of fuel, you move only one space. When the first player has completed three cities, the player with the most fuel wins. However, the player who has the most fun is the "real winner."

—description from the publisher

Part of Cheatwell Games series of 'Host Your Own' games. This version contains 100, 500, and 1000 notes which players use to bet on the outcome of races. The game contains a wipe clean board and temporary marker to go with a bookmakers ledger.
The races themselves consist of clips of Greyhounds on a DVD accompanying the game which are played to give the results.

The great evil has fallen, and has taken the capital with it. Where once there was a kingdom, there is now only the Wildlands. In a lawless fantasy world, you must band together for survival, treasure, or maybe even glory. Players control rival factions, each with a unique deck of cards dictating their abilities across the battlefield. Some focus on ranged prowess, some on raw strength, and others on the bond between characters, offering a wide range of playstyles to explore.

Created by award-winning game designer Martin Wallace, this miniatures board game contains everything you need to dive straight into the dynamic fantasy world of Wildlands. Simple enough to pick up and play, but packed with tactical nuances that will keep you coming back for more, it is the perfect approachable skirmish game with endless replayability.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Wildlands: Map Pack 1 – The Warlock's Tower & The Crystal Canyons

name.value: Tactician: the Game of Battlefield Strategy

item.description:
Tactician is a two-player turn-based game of tactics and strategy in which the players are medieval generals. Each player commands an army of Archers, Pikemen, Mounted Archers, and Knights who fight to destroy the foe and win the day.

Players first choose which advanced tactics to use, if any, and then assemble the game board. Choose at least four of the fourteen square tiles and arrange them so all tiles are accessible and both players have an equal number of starting squares. For a challenge, use the Tactical Terrain side of the tiles.

Each player begins with between eight and twenty units of their choosing, deployed within the first three rows of their side of the board. Turn phases include Movement, Combat, and Resupply. Combat is resolved based on Unit Advantages, situational bonuses, and a roll of the dice. All phases are completed by a single player before their opponent may begin their turn.

In order to win, one player must eliminate all enemy forces from the field or outnumber their opponent's troops by more than 3-to-1. Set-up and play average 60 minutes total.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Rabble is a party game for two teams played across three rounds. Teams compete to correctly guess all of the words on their team’s Rabble Cards the fastest, but each round has restrictions on the clues that players can give teammates.

Round 1 - Words, sounds, and gestures are allowed but players can’t say the card, part of the card, or spell the card.

Round 2 - Only one word per card but players can’t say the card or part of the card.

Round 3 - No words or sounds, only gestures.

Challenge Cards place additional effects on players (and make them do hilarious things), increasing the difficulty of completing each round. The same Rabble Cards are used each round so players need to remember the words and clues from previous rounds.

—description from the publisher

Speed Farkel is a fast, six-player version of the popular game, Pocket Farkel, in that the scoring combinations are the same. However, all players start with zero score and all players roll every turn at the same time. Players scramble to try to roll a minimum score that has been determined by rolling the 12-sided "IGNITION" die. The scorekeeper records and adds all scores after every round. The first player to get over 10,000 points is the winner.

UNO with a Minecraft Theme.

Playing UNO Minecraft is a TNT blast of fun. Watch out! The Creeper card will make you draw 3 more cards. And don't forget to yell "UNO!" before you mine your last card.
—description from the publisher

Dead 'til Dawn is a zombie group survival game for 3 to 8 players, where you don't actually need to survive to win! In each game, you will experience a unique zombie apocalypse story line with your friends full of choices, voting, alliances, combat, and betrayals. The game plays out like a group choose-your-own-adventure, only when players die they aren't out of the game - they become zombies with their own "zombie cravings" that they need to satisfy to win! Dead 'til Dawn is a unique, action packed and exciting game!

Dead 'til Dawn Mixes Role Play with a Competitive Twist. Each player starts with a Character card, with unique abilities and/or agendas, though it's still up to the player to decide how to play! The game starts by revealing 8 yellow-bannered character cards. These are the “core characters” who will allow new players to ease into the game. Some characters are helpful, some selfish, and some are downright evil. If a Character dies and joins the moaning dead, the bottom half of their Character card will show how they can still win by satisfying a “zombie craving."

Dead 'til Dawn plays out like a Zombie Movie. As the night falls, the survivors are hopeful - they have weapons, equipment, they're unhurt and ready to face the night. However, about half way through the game, as ammo runs low and weapons and tools have been broken or lost, and people's agendas begin to show...

Every game is a unique zombie story line. With 104 Event cards (or 120 with the deluxe set), 12 Setting cards (from the Dead Arm of the Law expansion), AND up to 25 possible Characters, this game never plays the same way twice.

Finally, players are NEVER out of the game. If a player dies, they simply switch sides and continue to play as a zombie! They draw zombie cards to achieve their "zombie craving," which usually features taking down those left alive. This feature not only keeps everyone involved, but as the game progresses and more players become zombies, it greatly increases the difficulty and drama of the game.

—description from the designer

link.value: Dead 'til Dawn: Dead Arm of the Law

item.description:
With Geistesblitz Junior, now children as young as four years old can play this quick-reaction game, grabbing the right object at the right time.

In this game, piglet, frog, ghost, and chick wait in the middle of the table. The cards show three of them in different colors. The objective is to grab whatever comes up in its original color. For children 6 years and up, the ghost occasionally appears in a dark nightgown. When this happen, keep your hands off all the figures!

item.description:
Today, the horse goes hog wild, and the deer dances with the cow. If you want to get the last tickets for the animal festival, you better rally at the round-up!

In Rock the Bock, the player who gets the most animals from their hand onto the festival grounds wins. Groups with too many animals have to stay out, though. A good connection to the black market and a cleverly used VIP pass can't hurt.

item.description:
Once upon a time, lived a green giant named Buto Ijo. He gave a cucumber seed to old woman. Later on, the seed growth into giant cucumber. When the cucumber was slice, a cute baby appeared. The baby was named Timun Mas. 8 years later, Green Giant was back to take Timun mas as his food.

You play as Timun Mas. Bringing 4 magical weapons, you have to beat down the Green Giant. What are the weapons? Cucumber seed, salt, terasi, and needle. Collect all this weapons and attack the Green Giant.

Each player plays as Timun mas. You are the winner if you are able to collect Greent Giant greater than others.

Batik is known as heritage of Indonesia’s culture. Therefore, we should keep it since it’s very sublime. Throughout this board game, we can play together with our family or friends. This game uses an unique local theme without losing its essence or its philosophy.

Player should collect component cards in order to create a Batik tile. Every single Batik tile is placed next to other tile so that it’s connected and create a pattern. Every time player buy a tile or use a tile, s/he will get a victory point. Moreover, player also has a chance to switch variate spell cards. By using this cards, player can distract another player or even speed up the action to get highest point. Player with highest point will be the champion.

An Introduction to the Heavy Gear World
This introductory game contains a simplified version of the Heavy Gear rules that keeps all the flavor of the game, but is easier to learn and faster to play. It does not require the use of the rulebook or of ANY other regular Heavy Gear supplements. The Heavy Gear Game demo includes 8 cut-out Gear counters (4 Hunters, 4 Jägers), 1 color hex map and a condensed version of the Silhouette tactical rules. All you need are a few six-sided dice.

—description from the introduction

Around the middle of the 17th century with the advent of the scientific method, a period of great change begins, called the scientific revolution. Many great scientists, with their theories and ideas, change our perception of the universe: Galileo Galilei, Copernicus, Kepler, Bacon and, above all, Sir Isaac Newton.

In Newton, players take the role of a young scientist who wants to become one of the great geniuses of this period. To do this, they travel around Europe, visit universities and cities, study to discover new theories, build new tools, and work to earn money.

The game is played over six rounds. Each round, every player plays five cards from their hand, with each played card allowing the player to perform one of the game's actions. An action has a variety of effects, which depend on the symbols of that action visible on the board. At the end of the round, a player can take back all the cards played except one. One card has to be left on the board, which means that you give up one possibility of doing that action, but also that the action will be carried out with greater strength. Fortunately, you can acquire new cards that will allow you to perform more actions and with additional powers.

After six rounds, you calculate your final scoring, and the player with the most VP wins.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The World Cup is just around the corner, and almost as exciting as the games themselves is the history of the many construction projects before the mega-sporting event.

In Machi Koro Fussball, you get to participate in that historic process yourself as an investor who is leading multiple building projects. Which strategy leads to success? Distribute the risk over multiple investments, or invest all at once in a stadium, training center and clubhouse? Watch what others build, take risks, and hope the markets go your way so that you can profit from your own football world!

item.description:
A (brigade to) division to corps/army level game with many pieces but incentive to create the (much fewer) higher level units to speed gameplay. 24 miles per hex - 30 hexes from Warsaw to Moscow. 15 half-month turns, IIJun41-IIJan42, enabling the Russian winter counteroffensive. Includes a breakthrough/Blitzkrieg second, tactical movement and combat result.

Has air units and simplified/abstracted airwar rules.

Introductory subgames for Leningrad, Moscow, and (a little one we have played the heck out of) Rostov.

Show & Tile is a party game for 3-6 players that's suitable for all ages! Each player takes two sets of tangram tiles, picks a word, and starts building. At the end of 90 seconds, put your tiles down and try to guess everyone's words!

Can't draw? No problem! Tangrams have been around for centuries, and can be used to construct anything you can imagine!

In this new cooperative board game Luffy and his crew arrive in Water 7, the famous island-city with its seven naval shipyards. They soon realize that their boat, the Going Merry, is not reparable! They will have to find material in order to build a new one. But the CP9 will do everything to stop their progress and have kidnapped Robin. Will they be able to save their friend, build the Thousand Sunny and board it before the Aqua Laguna, a gigantic wave, invades the game?

From the hit manga and anime, One Piece.
An official TOEI Animation product ensuring quality and authenticity
Instructions available in Spanish, German, Italian and French.

On your turn you roll and reroll your progress dice to use them to get victory points, resources and move around the board, trying to get the pieces to build the new ship and to rescue Nico Robin. If you can not avoid the CP9 enemies, you will fight using combat dices and your resources against them.

The enemy figures are moved by an event deck of cards, and after some turns, the Aqua Laguna waves will start to invade the board. You and your team must be quick! If you are covered by the Aqua Laguna water, you can be eliminated. And if the water invades everything (all Aqua Laguna counters are used), all of you will lose.

However, if you finish the ship and rescue Nico Robin in time, the player with most victory points will be the real winner!

Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Anatomy Fluxx takes players deep into the human body, and from "Blood Vessels", "Bones", "Testes", and "Uterus", the game is packed with body bits that keep you ticking. Be on the lookout for "Virus", "Mutation", and "Bacteria" Creepers; and UnGoals like "Cancer". The game also includes two learning rules to get your brain in gear with anatomical trivia. Anatomy Fluxx is for external use only.

Supervillain is a card & dice game where players, branded Villains by the corrupted Establishment, compete to expose the perverting influences on our institutions and governments; its up to YOU to expose the corruption!

Using Characters and Items to claim Capers, Villains put a spotlight on corruption - spreading information like modern-day Robin Hoods.

The Villain who Claims the most Caper points is crowned the Supervillain!

Compete to solve Capers and interfere with other Villains' plans using Shenanigans cards. Combat can ensue, as the Villain to your left may block your attempted Caper.

Villains play Character & Item cards with values that represent the number of dice they roll to solve that portion of the Caper; the Villain to your left rolls the number of dice on the Caper to "set the point" to match or beat.

Game length is adjustable depending on how many Capers players agree to play for at the beginning of the game, usually from 30-60 minutes. Solo play time is typically 20-30 minutes.

Each game comes with 54 high-quality, non-toxic cards made in the USA (8 Chessex dice - from the UK - included).

—description from the publisher

name.value: HEXplore It: The Forests of Adrimon

item.description:
The forests were once populated by the elves of old- stewards of nature and protectors of the realm of fey. They departed nearly a century ago, emptying their pristine cities. Slowly the settlements were repopulated by other races and culture eventually returned to their walls.

Now, however, the peoples of the forest kneel to one enigmatic sorceress named Adrimon. All who enter slowly succumb to her presence, eventually becoming mindless slaves bound to her will. The cities are now lost, havens only to the mind-wiped. They work tirelessly on the Magi's automatons, enormous constructs fueled by the souls she has bound.

There have been heroes who have faced her and failed. In each attempt, they sacrificed themselves, vowing an oath that just might lead to Adrimon's undoing. These oaths gave power to their equipment creating relics that can diminish her magic, but they have been broken to pieces and scattered throughout the land. It is whispered that the only way Adrimon can be defeated is to find these relic fragments and piece them together.

Enter the Forests of Adrimon and attempt to gather the relic fragments, creating powerful equipment that may help destroy the sorceress. Players will be able to gain Favors from the spirits of the heroes who came before them, sneak into the mind-wiped cities, move though the fey-realm and interact with the Dryad (a powerful ally), battle tough foes and even save some of them from the Magi's wrath. There are hundreds of unique scenarios that can affect each game.

Team up to create your heroes and unseat the terrible sorceress, freeing the mind-wiped from their terrible enslavement.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Dites-le en langue des signes ! Le jeu

item.description:
Card game to learn French sign language.
Players have cards in their hands, they are mainly cards with a word and a drawing of its translation in sign language, but there is also action cards for attack and defense. At their turn, a player plays up to 3 cards. A “sign” card is played as a challenge to an another player: the one playing the card
says the word, or makes the sign, and the other one has to translate. The player winning the challenge wins the card, and the first player to 10 cards wins the game.

Le jeu contient 100 cartes et s’utilise avec l’application Elix. Il permet de découvrir 50 signes de base de la langue des signes Française (LSF).
À chaque tour, lancez des défis « signes » aux autres joueurs et devenez incollable sur la LSF !
Le jeu s’adresse à tous les curieux de la langue des signes et favorise l’ouverture vers la communauté sourde.
Surprenez votre famille, vos amis ou collègues avec ce jeu et développez une autre façon de communiquer ensemble.

name.value: 赤の国 青の国 (Red Kingdom & Blue Kingdom)

item.description:
There was a red nation and a blue nation in one land. You are the king of one of these nations. The land has five bases, including the castles of each nation. To win the game, you must occupy all five bases or defeat the enemy king. Use your soldiers to grab these bases!

Gameplay in èµ¤ã®å›½ é’ã®å›½ (Red Nation Blue Nation) alternates in turns. On a turn, a player draws cards based on the bases they hold up to a maximum hand size of five cards. You can dispatch a soldier from your hand onto a base, with the sword showing your attack value against the shield's defense value in the base.

Russian tank brigade up to army level. 3 turns per month - Oct-Jan - for a total of 12 turns, enabling the Russian winter counteroffensive. 16 hexes Smolensk to Moscow - 15 miles per hex. Blitzkrieg/breakthrough attacks.

Roads as well as railroads mapped.

—description from the designer

Welcome to the market of beautiful things! As well-to-do citizens in Mercado, gamers wander around the stalls, always on the lookout for special items to enhance their reputation. Noble shawls, elegant jewelry, or golden trophies — with such a selection, the decision is difficult. But those who do not carry matching coins can also be unlucky because the other players have the same goal and might grab the valuable items from under your nose.

In more detail, different market stalls, each with one product, are laid out as panels in the center of the table. Each player has a personal bag containing different coins. On a turn, you draw three coins from it blind and place them at the market tables of your choice. If a player has paid all the necessary coins of a product, they receive the board and thereby increase their reputation. Some tablets bring extra privileges or seals, others bring counterfeit money that might wander into a bag. Who can buy the most valuable goods?

item.description:
Lost Cities has been around for ages, and now you can travel these expeditions in a handy portable format, with you once again needing to forge paths across the Himalayas, along volcanoes, under water, and through the rainforest or the desert — but beware of bandits who make for surprising turns!

Each step you take in Lost Cities: To Go requires a tile in the color of the chosen expedition, but you can place tiles only if they're higher than what's been placed previously. Only by finding the right mix of tiles will you stay in front and win.

This portable-format push your luck tile game is the Lost Cities equivalent to Keltis Mitbringspiel with the usual Lost Cities scoring rules and some additional ideas, including a storage where players may keep two tiles for a later use, some raid tiles that help discarding a few tiles and some extra actions provided by the lowest-numbered (2, 3, 4) tiles.

item.description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play. For ages 8 and up.

On a player's turn, they shake up the bottle containing the 19 discs that are white (salt) on one side and black (pepper) on the other and then pour all them out calling out either Salt or Pepper.

They score 1 point for each token that came out on the side they called out. Those go back in the bottom while the others are set off to the side.

They repeat the process and may call out a different color with the remaining tokens. A player continues to do this until there are no more tokens in the bottle.

There are a few other special rules for outcomes based on what side of the tokens come out (all the same side, 7 or more of the same color. etc)

First player to 100 points win.

Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play.

Tokens are numbered 1 to 40. Each player received 4 random tokens and 10 chili pepper markers. At the beginning of the round, each player antes 1 pepper marker.

The start player will place a token face down and claim it is higher than X. Players can challenge or the next player may place one of their tokens face down saying it is higher than X (what the previous person claimed).

Instead of placing a token, you may challenge someone and place 2 of your pepper markers in the pot or you may challenge out of turn by placing 3 peppers. Reveal the card, if the player was lying the challenger receives all the peppers. if they were telling the truth, that player received the peppers. Players then redraw back to 4 tokens.

Play continues until one player is out of peppers and whoever has the most peppers at that time wins.

Main aim
A strategy game where you need to skillfully place construction blocks to build three historic sites from the Nouvelle France era, outwit your opponents, and thereby gain points. Add to that three further ways of either bettering your score or hindering your opponents.

Concept and Goal of the Game
Each turn, carefully place a construction block to help build either the military redoubt, the church, or the seigneurial mill. At the end of each turn, players gain points based on the placement of these blocks. Three times during the game, it will snow and this is when players receive extra points based on the number of cubes of their colour present in the level being tallied up. The snowdrifts are then added to each building, fitting around and hiding the level that has just been tallied, therefore limiting the remaining space available to gain points. The player who has the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Playing the Game
Each turn, a player draws a card illustrating a type of construction block, taking the one indicated from the stock pile. They need to add the block to one of the buildings in line with the rules of play: a wall must not be more than 3 cubes high; blocks must be within limits shown on the foundation tiles; blocks must not be inserted underneath another one already in play etc. Once the block has been placed, one point is awarded for each newly added cube of the player’s colour, with further points being added for all the cubes already in play of the same color that this new block touches. Therefore, players should try to have as many of the cubes already in play of their colour touching those of corresponding colour in the newly placed block to maximize their score per turn. Also, strategically played ally cards and colourless blocks allow players to increase their scores.
When a snowflake card is drawn from the construction-block deck, the game stops, and points are awarded to each player based on the number of cubes of their colour found in the level being tallied. The snowdrifts are then added. This happens three times during the game. When the first snowflake card is drawn, points are tallied for the first level of each of the three construction sites. When the second snowflake card is drawn, points are tallied for the second level. Finally, when the third snowflake is drawn the tally is done for the third and final level, and the game ends. The tally sticks placed next to each building indicate how points are attributed each level. On the tally sticks there are +, - and x 2 symbols indicating how many points players win or lose based on the number of cubes of their colour in the level being tallied.

End of the Game 
The game ends when the third snow flake is turned over. Points are tallied for a final time for the third floor of each construction site. The player having the most points on the points’ board is declared the winner and earns the title of Royal Engineer for New France.

In this second album First Impact Chapter 2 play as one of four members of the squadron urban scouts through these next 8 episodes. While avoiding zombies and mutants , you'll walk the streets in silence, climb on the roofs of buildings , drive a powerful vehicle customized or dare go down into the sewer ...

These are but, a few of the many actions that you can perform as a hero of Z First Impact. Will you to complete your shipment in hostile territory, despite the toxic attacks Boobers, the presence of pests on the roof, or the cries of howler ?

Play with four different characters each with unique characteristics in order to fullfill the missions objectives.

You may use an android or iPhone augmented free software instead of using dice and you will also have lots of visual and gaming effects.

As new islands appear out of the mist, send your voyagers in search of wealth and adventure! In Embark, you will load various boats heading to these new, uninhabited islands in order to explore, colonize, and mine their riches. Only fully-loaded boats will launch, so assign your voyagers carefully. Explorers will scout out the islands, unlocking their mysteries. Miners will collect ore, and colonists will cultivate farms and reap the benefits that the islands have to offer. Watch out for your opponents’ warriors, who can replace your voyagers and take over their jobs!

Embark is a game for 2-5 players, designed by Philip duBarry, and developed by Seth Jaffee. It lasts about 15 minutes per player, and could be described as a light-to-medium weight game.

In Embark, you and your friends simultaneously assign your voyagers to boats, then take turns assigning them jobs by placing them into specific berths in the boats. When a boat is full, it launches, carrying your voyagers to one of the islands in play, where your voyagers will start to perform the jobs to which they were assigned:


 Explorers explore the island, scoring 1 point per round, and increasing an exploration bonus for the island.
 Miners collect ore, which will score an end game bonus.
 Colonists build farms worth a chunk of points. Having a majority of colonists also wins a player the exploration bonus for the island.
 Captains can do any of the three jobs above.
 Warriors must displace another voyager and take over their job, sending the displaced voyager back to the owner's pub to be reassigned next round.


After six rounds of assigning voyagers and launching boats, the game ends, bonuses are tallied, and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Eyegamer — The Ultimate Board Game To Have Fun And Train Your Memory.

In Eyegamer, the goal of the game is simple. The player’s task is to collect as many pairs of cards as possible in the shortest period of time. Eyegamer is a re-implementation of the classic memory game, with a minimalist, black & white card design. The minimalist design of the cards is designed to make it harder for you to match cards.

At the start of the game, shuffle and place the entire 40 card deck in a 10x4 (4 rows of 10 cards each) layout. The cards should be placed so that the patterned side of the cards are face down, and the "Eyegamer" card backs facing up.

On your turn, simply pick any two cards and turn them over, showing the patterned sides. If they match, remove them from play. Each matched set should stay with the player/team that matched them. If the chosen cards do not match, flip them back so that the "Eyegamer" card backs are facing up. They remain in play.

At the end of the game, each matched set is worth 1 point. The player/team with the most points wins the game.

There are three modes of play included in the game:


 Solo - a 1 player challenge
 Challenge - a 2 player challenge
 Team Deathmatch - Up to 8 players (team sizes of 2 and 4 per team) with team members alternating turns choosing cards.


You can also purchase multiple Eyegamer decks to create larger grids for the game, thus making the game more challenging.

It's springtime! Time to restore your farm to its former glory! Lucky for you, there's a regional farming competition going on! The trophy for this year's most beautiful farm will be given to the farmer who has the most animals and cornfields! Will you win the competition in Farmini?

item.description:
You are a survivor in a near-future Europe that has collapsed under the weight of its own political errors, in the wake of a bloody class-war fuelled by genetic modifications. In Posthuman, you journeyed to the last bastion of organized human society in the area: The Fortress. A year down the line, you have become an active part of that society and honed the skills you need to fulfill your role there. But the mutants are gaining ground...

Posthuman Saga is a standalone survival game in the Posthuman universe. You play a seasoned member of the Fortress' militia, sent out beyond the defensive perimeter to explore and hopefully reconnect with outposts the Fortress has lost touch with, while searching for scavengeable sites along the way. You have to forge across a crumbled land where resources are spare and mutants roam the ruined mansions and forests alike.

Like the initial Posthuman, this is a sandbox-style survival journey, but the game system in Posthuman Saga is entirely different from that of the first game in the series. Players win by completing various objectives that suit different characters and playing styles. It has an emphasis on tactical choices on two levels: the journey expressed through an innovative modular tile map puzzle and the individual story and combat encounters. The latter are fast, card-based affairs involving tough choices with future consequences. Posthuman Saga boasts over one hundred, finely crafted, story scenes with a simple, push-your-luck mechanic that supplements the emergent narrative afforded by the game. Mutation is a way of life in the Posthuman world, and it can have its advantages, but it can easily get out of control…

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

link.value: Posthuman Saga: The Outcast Promo Pack

item.description:
The Living is a cooperative board game with heavy emphasis on story. You play as a small group of survivors trying to make it through the aftermath of the zombie apocalypse. Each turn have to hold off the living dead and scrounge for supplies. But you also have to make difficult story choices that will show a lot about the types of survivors you are.

The Living is playable right out of the box; the game will teach you the rules as you play, allowing you to focus on the story.

The game won prizes for best innovation and best board game at Fastaval 2018.

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: You Are a Liar (or maybe not)

item.description: Life is unpredictable - sometimes it's hard to tell the difference between truth and lies. Here is your chance to practice! In You Are a Liar players take turns being the reader and guesser. The guesser has to determine who is lying in the stories being told by the readers. There is always at least one liar in the group. Guess the most lies and win the game!

name.value: Im Himmel empfängt man die Krone der Belehrung

item.description:
This is a very early German game, possibly 17th-18th century, and perhaps unique. The rules and the outcome from landing in various squares are certainly handwritten on the thick paper board. Differences in the shapes of the space numbers suggest calligraphy rather than printing, with irregularities in the shapes of the spaces pointing to a hand-drawn board as well.

Like many early board games, its theme is moral improvement. The game title translates as: "In Heaven you will receive the Crown of Instruction".

In play, it is a typical spin-and-move along a 100-space track that spirals inward, with penalties and bonuses affecting various spaces along the way.

Emprise is an fast paced action economy combat card game that also doubles as a 52/54 card deck. By deploying troops and commissioning officers, your mission is to reinforce your position while repressing the enemies'. You will be forced into tense situations, sabotage your allies, rescue enemies, and sacrifice your own troops to win the battle.

The objective is to earn victories by having enough reinforcements played at the end of your turn. However, each reinforcement can also be used for hand management, strategy denial, assaulting enemies' reinforcements, or controlling gameplay.

Disney Pixar Fanimation is a Disney Pixar themed board game. The board is customizable and consists of four interlocking board game sections that each have two unique sides. These board can be set up with between 2-4 sections depending on how long you want the game to be.

Game-play consists of spinning a spinner to determine how many spaces you move. You will land on a colored space that corresponds with three decks of cards. The decks are "Pardner Up" (pick a partner, draw a card, then do as the card says), "Head 2 Head" (pick an opponent, draw a card, then do as the card says), or "Go Solo" (hand the card to the player to the left, and you do what the player reads). If you successfully complete the card or win the challenge, you follow the bonus rule for the board game section that you are on.

The goal is to be the first player to the finish line.

Color-In Kingdoms is a Roll-and-Write game designed for Gen Can't 2017 where players are the lead architects trying to build a beautiful Province for the Royal Family, but, being hampered by the whims of that same family.

Each of the 4 Royal Family Dice represents the construction desire of that family member, the 1 Royal Duties Dice represents pressing duties family members must attend to, so removes them from the pool for that turn.

Victory Points (VP) will be awarded at the end of the game based on the scoring as outlined on the Construction sheet.
